books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: The First Sir Percy
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A man and his followers try again to overthrow the Stadtholder of the Netherlands.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: Fannyâ€™s First Play
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A young woman writes a play to shock her father, in which two respectable families deal with their with disreputable children.

books.title: Zuni Folktales
books.author: Frank Hamilton Cushing
books.summary: A collection of folktales from the Zuni culture.

books.title: The Virginian
books.author: Owen Wister
books.summary: A cowboy working on a Wyoming Territory cattle ranch in the 1880s embraces the spirit of the American West.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: Lord Peter Views the Body
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: A collection of short stories in which an aristocratic amateur detective solves a variety of crimes.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by H. Beam Piper ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Cordwainer Smith
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Cordwainer Smith ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
